Package net.flytre.mechanix.api.gui

Class ToggleButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.client.gui.DrawableHelper
      • net.minecraft.client.gui.widget.AbstractButtonWidget
        • net.minecraft.client.gui.widget.AbstractPressableButtonWidget
          • net.minecraft.client.gui.widget.ButtonWidget
            • net.flytre.mechanix.api.gui.ToggleButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraft.client.gui.Drawable, net.minecraft.client.gui.Element
    public class ToggleButton
extends net.minecraft.client.gui.widget.ButtonWidget
    A toggle button takes a 16x64 image and displays 4 states from top to bottom: (state 0, state 0 hovered, state 1, state 1 hovered) based on the circumstances. Predictably used to toggle between 2 states, ie input and output or round robin mode and normal mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToggleButton

        public ToggleButton​(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    int state,
                    net.minecraft.util.Identifier texture,
                    net.minecraft.client.gui.widget.ButtonWidget.PressAction onPress,
                    char id)
        Instantiates a new Toggle button.
        Parameters:
        x - the x
        y - the y
        width - the width
        height - the height
        state - 0 or 1 for 1st / 2nd frame
        texture - the texture location
        onPress - what to do when the button is pressed
        id - text to overlay on button
